Cf [[Know the elements of aetiological orientation of acute infectious diarrhoea|table]]

In children, viral watery diarrhoea is often accompanied by fever (especially rotavirus).

Clostridium difficile diarrhoea is rare in children and (almost) non-existent before the age of 4 because of the absence of a toxin receptor. On the other hand, children are readily colonised by C. difficile, including toxin-secreting organisms. it is therefore unnecessary to test young children for C. difficile.

properties.question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding Clostridium difficile diarrhoea in children?
properties.option_a: C. difficile diarrhoea is common in children under the age of 4 due to the presence of a toxin receptor.
properties.option_b: C. difficile diarrhoea is rare in children and almost non-existent before the age of 4 because of the absence of a toxin receptor.
properties.option_c: C. difficile diarrhoea is equally common in children and adults, regardless of age.
properties.option_d: C. difficile diarrhoea is only found in children with a history of antibiotic use.
